summary: This document is an email chain from July 2008 regarding the Epstein investigation, involving a U.S. Attorney's office and a private attorney. It discusses attempts to contact a victim's mother and the sharing of client names by the attorney.

persons.name: Ted Leopold
persons.context: He is the sender of an email providing the names of two clients to a U.S. Attorney, indicating he is assisting with the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Spencer Kuvin
persons.context: He is copied on an email from Ted Leopold to a U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in correspondence regarding the Epstein investigation, with Kuvin copied on Leopold's email.

events.title: Attorney provides client names to U.S. Attorney
events.description: Ted Leopold sends an email to a U.S. Attorney providing the names of two clients in relation to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Attempt to contact victim's mother
events.description: An email states there has been no luck yet getting in touch with a victim's mother, indicating ongoing investigative efforts.

keyFacts: An attorney, Ted Leopold, provided the names of two clients to a U.S. Attorney's office as part of the Epstein investigation.
There were ongoing attempts in July 2008 to contact the mother of a victim (referred to as 'M. mother'), which had not yet been successful.
The correspondence involves legal professionals, indicating coordination between private attorneys and federal prosecutors in the investigation.
